result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Field was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 12:18pm [mo]
Defendant Thomas J Field in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 30 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns
--random drug screens at least once per month, in the discretion of the Agent
--to submit DNA sample to designee
--to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  69  days
recess: 12:30pm

Case called at 2:51pm [mo]
Defendant Thomas J Field in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

On State's notice to Admit Expert Testimony at Trial:
--no objection from the Defense

On the State's Notice to Admit Statements:
--No Objection from the Defense, No Miranda/Goodchild issues
--The Court finds the statements are admissible

Upon questioning by the Court, Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Field does have the prior convictions the State is attesting
--Mr. Field has 3 prior convictions for purposes of Trial

As to State's Jury Instructions:
--no objection from the Defense 

The Court and Counsel discuss Trial, the Court determines that:
--no alternate is to be carried
--1 day trial is appropriate

recess: 2:58pm

[MK] case called at 9:13am. 
Defendant Thomas J Field appears via videoconferencing from the Green Lake County Jail, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa, is present in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court finds that the Warrant has been served; it is to be removed from any database. 
Arguments are given on the State's request for cash bail.
The Court orders a $1,000  Cash Bond, with the same conditions as previously ordered. 
The Court schedules the case for trial and the Court issues its Scheduling Order in written form to counsel.
recess 9:21am. 


NEXT: (1) FSSC on 9/28/15 at 11:00am,  (2) Jury Trial on October 1st and/or October 2nd at 8:30am.

Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears in court.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant Thomas Field does not appear.
ADA Hall requests a bench warrant and forfeiture with bond.
Attorney De La Rosa objects. Further he requests the warrant be stayed and a hearing date next week.
The Court order a bench warrant, body only.
The Court orders the bond be forfieted.

case called at 1:37pm. [MK]
Defendant Thomas J Field in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Field verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
After Mr. Field indicates that he desires to have representation by counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Rolland S. Zibell
--no contact with Joshua J. Hanson
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
recess 1:41pm 

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance on 1/20/15 at 1:00pm. (Mr. Field will be in Dane County Jail serving a sentence at that time-- please arrange for v/c appearance; if that is not possible a writ will be needed)
